frame.name: Goal
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Landmark</fen> (in combination with the image schema evoked by particular targets) serves to pick out the final location of a <fen>Trajector</fen> in a construed or actual motion event.
<ex><fex name="Trajector">Flights</fex> <t>into</t> <fex name="Landmark">Denver</fex> are not permitted <fex name="Time">at this time</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Landmark
FE.definition: <def-root>The relatively locatable entity which serves as a basis for determining the location of the <fen>Trajector</fen> using the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Profiled_region
FE.definition: <def-root>The location (located with respect to the <fen>Landmark</fen>) which is profiled by the particular image schema pertaining to the locative relation.</def-root>

FE.name: Trajector
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which is construed to be in motion, whose location at the end of the construed motion event is in question.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Trajector</fen> is located in the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: to.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: relating a location to a goal of motion

lexUnit.name: into.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: relating a location to a goal of motion; goal is inside some type of border
